question: What is Google Cloud DNS?

answers.text: A cloud-based file storage service
A managed Domain Name System (DNS) service
A cloud-based virtual machine service
A cloud networking service

question: What is the primary purpose of DNS?

answers.text: To provide cloud storage services
To resolve domain names to IP addresses
To manage virtual machines in the cloud
To route traffic between different cloud regions

question: What is the maximum number of resource record sets (RRsets) allowed per managed zone in Google Cloud DNS?

answers.text: Unlimited

question: Which record type is used to associate an IP address with a domain name in DNS?

answers.text: MX record
NS record
A record
TXT record

question: What is the purpose of a Time-to-Live (TTL) value in DNS records?

answers.text: To specify the encryption algorithm used
To set the record creation date
To define the maximum number of queries per second
To indicate how long the record can be cached

question: Which DNS record type is used to specify mail servers for the domain?

answers.text: A record
MX record
CNAME record
PTR record

question: What is the significance of a Canonical Name (CNAME) record in DNS?

answers.text: It points to an IPv4 address
It aliases one domain to another
It specifies mail servers for the domain
It provides information about authoritative name servers

question: What is the purpose of DNSSEC (DNS Security Extensions) in Google Cloud DNS?

answers.text: To encrypt DNS queries and responses
To authenticate and verify DNS data integrity
To prevent unauthorized access to DNS records
To limit the number of DNS requests per second

question: Which Google Cloud service integrates with Cloud DNS for DDoS (Distributed Denial of Service) protection?

answers.text: Cloud Armor
Cloud CDN
Cloud Interconnect
Cloud Identity-Aware Proxy

question: What is the purpose of a Start of Authority (SOA) record in DNS?

answers.text: To specify mail servers for the domain
To define the domain's authoritative name server
To point to an IPv6 address
To indicate the domain's Time-to-Live (TTL) value

question: Which protocol is used for DNS queries and responses?

answers.text: HTTP
SMTP
DNS
FTP

question: What is the maximum number of managed zones allowed per Google Cloud DNS project?
Which command-line tool can be used to manage Google Cloud DNS from the terminal?

answers.text: gcloud compute
gcloud dns
gcloud storage

question: What is the purpose of the DNS Anycast IP addresses used by Google Cloud DNS?

answers.text: To handle DNS queries over IPv6
To distribute DNS queries across multiple locations
To provide reverse DNS lookup
To assign IP addresses to domain names

question: What does the acronym FQDN stand for in the context of DNS?

answers.text: Fully Qualified Domain Name
Fast Query Delivery Network
First Quality DNS Name
Flexible Query Domain Name

question: Which DNS record type is used to map an IP address to a domain name?

answers.text: A record
MX record
CNAME record
PTR record

question: What is the purpose of the `gcloud dns record-sets transaction` command?

answers.text: To create a new managed zone
To manage DNS record sets within a transaction
To delete an entire DNS project
To configure DNSSEC for a domain

question: Which DNS record type is used for IPv6 addresses?

answers.text: AAAA record
A record
CNAME record
MX record

question: How does Google Cloud DNS handle DNS resolution for private IP addresses?

answers.text: It automatically blocks private IP resolution
It forwards private IP queries to public DNS servers
It allows resolution of private IP addresses within the VPC
It redirects private IP queries to the Cloud DNS proxy

To add new DNS record sets
To configure DNSSEC for a domain
To list existing DNS record sets

question: How does Google Cloud DNS handle DNS resolution for conflicting DNS policies?

It applies the most specific DNS policy for the queried domain
